contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=March 2012}} {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Young Loud and Snotty | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Dead Boys]] | Cover = Thedeadboys.jpg | Released = October 1977 | Recorded = 1977, [[Electric Lady Studios]], New York City | Genre = [[Punk rock]] | Length = 35:23 | Label = [[Sire Records|Sire]] | Producer = [[Genya Ravan]] | Last album = | This album = ''Young Loud and Snotty''<br/>(1977) | Next album = '''''[[We Have Come for Your Children]]'''''<br/>(1978) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4.5|5}} <ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r34857|first=Ned|last=Raggett|accessdate=September 27, 2011}}</ref> | rev2 = [[Robert Christgau]] | rev2Score = B<ref name="Christgau">{{cite news|last=Christgau|first=Robert|authorlink=Robert Christgau|date=October 31, 1977|url=http://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/cg/cgv11-77.php|title=Christgau's Consumer Guide|newspaper=[[The Village Voice]]|location=New York|accessdate=April 29, 2013}}</ref> }} '''''Young Loud and Snotty''''' is the first studio album by the American [[punk band]] [[Dead Boys]]. It was recorded and released in 1977 on [[Sire Records]], produced by [[Genya Ravan]]. ==Track listing== All tracks composed by [[Stiv Bators]], Cheetah Chrome & Jimmy Zero ([[Copyright]] Omfug Music/Dead Boys Music/Bleu Disque Music-[[ASCAP]]); except where indicated # "[[Sonic Reducer]]" ([[David Thomas (musician)|David Thomas]], Cheetah Chrome) – 3:05 # "All This and More" – 2:49 # "What Love Is" – 2:08 # "Not Anymore" – 3:38 # "Ain't Nothin' to Do" – 2:25 # "Caught with the Meat in Your Mouth" – 2:06 # "[[Little Girl (Syndicate of Sound song)|Hey Little Girl]]" (Bob Gonzales, Don Baskin; Copyright Screen Gems-[[EMI]]/Duane Music-[[Broadcast Music Incorporated|BMI]]) – 3:01 (Recorded live at [[CBGB]]) # "I Need Lunch" – 3:36 # "High Tension Wire" – 3:05 # "Down in Flames" – 2:15 # Medley "Not Anymore/Ain't Nothin' to Do" – 7:15 ==Personnel== *[[Stiv Bators]] - vocals *[[Cheetah Chrome]] - lead guitar *Jimmy Zero - rhythm guitar *Jeff Magnum - bass guitar *[[Johnny Blitz]] - drums *Ronald Binder - voice on "Down in Flames" ==Production== *Arranged by Dead Boys *Produced by Genya Ravan *Recorded and engineered by Dave Wittman *Assistant recording engineer: Jim Galante *Mixed by Harvey Goldberg *Mastered by Ted Jensen ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.discogs.com/Dead-Boys-Young-Loud-And-Snotty/release/877193 "Young Loud and Snotty" at discogs] {{DEFAULTSORT:Young Loud And Snotty}} [[Category:1977 debut albums]] [[Category:The Dead Boys albums]] [[Category:Sire Records albums]] [[Category:Albums recorded at Electric Lady Studios]]
